cscie55.hw4.bank

Class BankImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscie55.hw4.bank.BankImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Bank

    public class BankImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements Bank
    The BankImpl Class is an impemenation of the Bank Interface that contains methods such as creating an account for a client, performing transfers for a customer, obtaining a customer's total balance.
    See Also:
    Bank

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BankImpl() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addAccount(Account account) 
      int numberOfAccounts()
      This method retuns the number of accounts that a given account id may have
      long totalBalances()
      This method returns the total balance across various accounts of the same account id
      void transferLockingAccounts(int fromId, int toId, long amount)
      This method performs withdrawl from one account and deposit in another isolating the synchronization to the two accounts providing better concurrency.
      void transferLockingBank(int fromId, int toId, long amount)
      This method performs withdrawl from one account and deposit in another that performs a synchronization on the entire bank object but does not provide concurrency.
      void transferWithoutLocking(int fromId, int toId, long amount)
      This method performs withdrawl from one account and deposit in another account to simulate separate threads and demonstrates what happends when synchronization is missing

      • transferWithoutLocking

        public void transferWithoutLocking(int fromId,
                          int toId,
                          long amount)
                            throws InsufficientFundsException
        This method performs withdrawl from one account and deposit in another account to simulate separate threads and demonstrates what happends when synchronization is missing
        Specified by:
        transferWithoutLocking in interface Bank
        Parameters:
        fromId - the account id of which the transfer is coming from
        toId - the account id to whihc the transfer is going to
        amount - the amount value that is being passed to the transfer method
        Throws:
        InsufficientFundsException - this gets thrown in attempting to transfer funds from an account with a 0 balance

                       int toId,
                       long amount)
                         throws InsufficientFundsException
